title: Marine Le Pen's 2027 presidential rivals adjust their strategies to her legal timetable
subhed: With the far-right leader due to hear her fate from the Court of Appeal on July 7, her prospective rivals in the 2027 presidential election are already preparing for the possibility that she may step aside for Jordan Bardella, and are strategizing how to exploit his weaknesses.
byline: By Sandrine Cassini, Alexandre Pedro, Olivier Pérou and Marie Pouzadoux

title: Trump threatens to bypass Congress and order new voting laws ahead of midterms
Macron defends European model at Munich Security Conference
Ex-president Hollande's 2027 presidential election comeback is fraught with obstacles
subhed: Once dismissed as far-fetched just a few months ago, former Socialist president François Hollande's candidacy is now seen as a credible scenario. However, he must face several obstacles within both the broader left and his Socialist party.
byline: By Olivier Pérou and Sandrine Cassini

title: How the Ivorian president's niece acted as Epstein's go-between
subhed: The Epstein files reveal the close relationship between the late financier and Nina Keita, who introduced him to young women and local business leaders. The niece of Côte d'Ivoire's president, Alassane Ouattara, now holds a senior position in Abidjan.

title: Winter Olympics 2026: US figure skating star Malinin stumbles, Shaidorov wins surprise gold
subhed: The 'Quad God', Ilia Malinin, a two-time defending world champion and undefeated for over two years, fell twice during his final.

title: Mika opens the doors to his Tuscany villa: 'Throw us anywhere, and we'll make poetry'
subhed: The singer will chair the 41st edition of the Victoires de la Musique, France's annual music awards ceremony, on Friday, following the late January release of his seventh album, 'Hyperlove.' Currently on tour, he will perform in Paris on Monday.

title: Don Lemon pleads not guilty to civil rights charges after covering a Minnesota church protest for his online channel
Nine people charged in Paris' Louvre ticket fraud scandal
Bangladesh ends its authoritarian chapter as BNP wins parliamentary majority
byline: By Carole Dieterich (Dhaka, Bangladesh, special correspondent)

title: Knife-wielding man shot by police at Arc de Triomphe in Paris

title: UK high court upholds activist group Palestine Action's challenge against government ban
ECB fines French bank Crédit Agricole for failing to identify climate risks
German Chancellor Merz urges US to repair ties with Europe
US immigration agency contracts thrive on Trump's anti-migrant policies
byline: By Nicolas Chapuis (New York (United States) correspondent)

title: Macron denounces 'antisemitic hydra' and calls for election bans for antisemitic and racist acts
France's demographics debate focuses on birth rates while ignoring touchier measures
subhed: Politicians have struggled to address the various aspects of France's current demographic shift. The debate on the issue remains focused on boosting birth rates, while steering clear of more sensitive topics such as immigration or the retirement age.
byline: By Julie Carriat and Solène Cordier

title: Why are major powers competing for control of the Arctic?
subhed: The Arctic has become a strategic focal point for countries, lying at the intersection of climate and geopolitical challenges. Climate change has sharply accelerated this transformation.

title: 'The decline in birth rates is a social phenomenon, not a woman's responsibility'
subhed: Instead of questioning the collective factors behind declining birth rates, the dominant narrative shifts responsibility onto women, laments Brigitte Grésy, former president of France's High Council for Gender Equality, and Micheline Misrahi-Abadou, professor at the faculty of medicine of Paris-Saclay University.

title: 'With Donald Trump, the image of digital multinational companies has become re-Americanized'
'The Washington Post became the collateral damage of Jeff Bezos's choice to forge the strongest possible ties with Trump'
The urgent need for a European strategy on economic sovereignty
